title: Vase, "Indian Encampment", 1909
inscribed: Artist's monogram incised on bottom, underglaze:  E.T.H., also, V Impressed on bottom, underglaze:  RP cipher with 14 flames, IX beneath 1659 B/V
provenance: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
creditline: Gift of Marcia and William Goodman
description: White clay body, thrown.  Cylindrical body, tapering upward, waisted below bulbous shoulder, truncated neck; no foot.  Decorated in silhouette around body with scene of Indian encampment along river bank.  Design of two teepees among trees in foreground with figures of Indians doing various activities--gathering wood and twigs, cooking, etc.  Across river more teepees.  Bottom third of body mottled dark green and brown.  Lower sky and river subtly shaded orange into pale yellow, upper sky shading into blue-green.  Figures, teepees and foliage in shades of brown and dark green.  Interior, white, glazed; bottom glazed.  Allover vellum glaze, cracklature.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Vase, "Indian Encampment", 1909.
1909. Glazed stoneware. Gift of Marcia and William Goodman. 1984-84-1.
